articles.author: Jarrett Renshaw, Nandita Bose
articles.description: Vice President Kamala Harris will campaign in the critical battleground state of Wisconsin on Tuesday for the first time as a presidential candidate after enough Democratic delegates pledged to endorse her, clearing her path to the nomination.
articles.title: Harris closes in on nomination with delegates secured, to campaign in Wisconsin

articles.author: Mohammad Ponir Hossain
articles.description: The Bangladesh government is expected to formally accept on Tuesday a court ruling to lower quotas for state jobs, media reported, meeting a key demand of the students who had been protesting for days.
articles.title: After protests, Bangladesh government to formally accept ruling on job quotas

articles.author: David Morgan
articles.description: U.S. Secret Service Director Kimberly Cheatle admitted to Congress on Monday that she and her agency failed when a would-be assassin wounded Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump at a July 13 campaign rally in Pennsylvania this week.
articles.title: US Secret Service director on Trump shooting: 'We failed'

articles.author: Sarita Singh, Nikunj Ohri
articles.description: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi's first post-election budget on Tuesday will seek to lay out an economic vision that balances fiscal prudence with the expectations of disgruntled voters and the demands of his coalition partners.
articles.title: India's Modi faces delicate balancing act in post-election budget

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Ari Rabinovitch, Hatem Khaled
articles.description: Israeli tank shelling and airstrikes killed at least 16 Palestinians near Khan Younis, Gaza medics said on Monday, after Israel issued new orders to evacuate some neighbourhoods following what it said were renewed attacks from those areas.
articles.title: Israel issues evacuation orders in south Gaza, kills 16 Palestinians

articles.author: Timour Azhari, Ahmed Rasheed
articles.description: Iraq wants troops from a U.S.-led military coalition to begin withdrawing in September and to formally end the coalition's work by September 2025, four Iraqi sources said, with some U.S. forces likely to remain in a newly negotiated advisory capacity.
articles.title: Iraq eyes drawdown of US-led forces starting September, sources say

articles.author: David Lawder
articles.description: Talks over a global tax deal are continuing well past a June 30 deadline and governments are now looking to a Group of 20 finance leaders meeting this week for progress on a stalled plan to reallocate taxing rights on large multinational companies.
articles.title: Digital tax talks in G20 spotlight as US tariff threat looms

articles.author: Walid Berrazeg
articles.description: Taiwan curtailed its annual Han Kuang war games on Tuesday as Typhoon Gaemi barrelled towards the island and the government issued a land warning given the expected strong winds and torrential rain as it hits the coast.
articles.title: Taiwan curtails annual war games as Typhoon Gaemi barrels towards island

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russia and China are increasingly cooperating in the Arctic region, which could impact regional stability, the U.S. military said as it released its strategy for the Arctic region on Monday.
articles.title: Growing cooperation between Russia and China in Arctic, Pentagon says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Thousands of people ordered from their homes in the face of a raging wildfire in a remote corner of eastern Canada can return home this week as the risk to their community diminished, authorities said over the weekend.
articles.title: Residents of eastern Canadian community menaced by wildfire can return home
